org.apache.ambari.server.controller

Class AmbariCustomCommandExecutionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.controller.AmbariCustomCommandExecutionHelper

  • public class AmbariCustomCommandExecutionHelper
extends Object
    Helper class containing logic to process custom command execution requests . This class has special support needed for SERVICE_CHECK and DECOMMISSION. These commands are not pass through as Ambari has specific persistence requirements.

    • Method Detail

      • addServiceCheckAction

        public void addServiceCheckAction(Stage stage,
                                  String hostname,
                                  String smokeTestRole,
                                  long nowTimestamp,
                                  String serviceName,
                                  String componentName,
                                  Map<String,String> actionParameters,
                                  boolean retryAllowed,
                                  boolean autoSkipFailure,
                                  boolean useLatestConfigs)
                           throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Creates and populates service check EXECUTION_COMMAND for host. Not all EXECUTION_COMMAND parameters are populated here because they are not needed by service check.
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException

      • validateAction

        public void validateAction(ExecuteActionRequest actionRequest)
                    throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Validate custom command and throw exception is invalid request.
        Parameters:
        actionRequest - the action request
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the action can not be validated

      • addExecutionCommandsToStage

        public void addExecutionCommandsToStage(ActionExecutionContext actionExecutionContext,
                                        Stage stage,
                                        Map<String,String> requestParams,
                                        ExecuteCommandJson executeCommandJson)
                                 throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Other than Service_Check and Decommission all other commands are pass-through
        Parameters:
        actionExecutionContext - received request to execute a command
        stage - the initial stage for task creation
        requestParams - the request params
        executeCommandJson - set of json arguments passed to the request
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException - if the commands can not be added

      • getCommandJson

        public ExecuteCommandJson getCommandJson(ActionExecutionContext actionExecContext,
                                         Cluster cluster,
                                         StackId stackId,
                                         String requestContext)
                                  throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Helper method to fill execution command information.
        Parameters:
        actionExecContext - the context
        cluster - the cluster for the command
        stackId - the stack id used to load service metainfo.
        Returns:
        a wrapper of the important JSON structures to add to a stage
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException

      • isTopologyRefreshRequired

        public boolean isTopologyRefreshRequired(String actionName,
                                         String clusterName,
                                         String serviceName)
                                  throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
        Determine whether or not the action should trigger a topology refresh.
        Parameters:
        actionName - the action name (i.e. START, RESTART)
        clusterName - the cluster name
        serviceName - the service name
        Returns:
        true if a topology refresh is required for the action
        Throws:
        org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException

                               throws org.apache.ambari.server.AmbariException
